review: Main reason for return: too many interruptions with wifi network. I have an Apple TV in our basement and decided to buy a Fire TV Stick for our upstairs TV thinking it would be convenient since, as advertised, all you'd have to do was stick it into your TV. But, on the box it states you should plug it into an outlet so now we have a cord hanging from our mounted TV (the one thing I was trying to avoid). I was excited to have the ability to stream Prime TV shows and have Netflix. But, upon watching a series on Netflix, about every 15 minutes it would need to buffer it seemed liked. I think we only went through one episode where there was no buffering needed. After it was buffering for the 8th time in a 40 min. episode, I went downstairs to see if it was our internet or if it was the Stick. The clarity was much better and the buffering stopped altogether upon watching it on the Apple TV in the basement. I am returning this and hope Amazon can fix the problem with later models as I will continue using the Apple TV in the meantime.

review: I have Fire TV on my Family Room TV, purchased this stick for my bedroom TV.  Works great, Sync with my Fire TV receiver was seamless. I can't say enough good things about Fire TV, but the one thing I haven't seen anyone say is how easy it is to use.  My 90 year old Dad has always had trouble with all the buttons on the cable remote (you know how many buttons and how small the print is on a remote).  Fire TV remote has eight buttons, just 8.  Now all he has to do is press the voice search (that button has a picture) and he is in business. Way to go Amazon.
